column1: People don't tend to mention the mechanism in pre-test (11/42), but they do in post-test (S post is 26/30, N is 39/43 - stat computed for S group pre- vs. post-, which has a lesser prevalence of mech than N)

Misconceptions are common in the pretest but not the post test, total 0.38 pre- to 0.10/0.12 (S/N) post-test. Ozone .19 to .03/.02 (S/N),  wrong GHG  .24 to 0.07/0.09 (S/N). (test on total misconceptions, S pre- to post-test)

Participants don't mention energy leaving the earth until prompted. Specifically, of the four codes that deal with this topic, only 6 mention something about "trapped heat" in the pre-test on the first (i.e., the only unscaffolded) question.
Use of infrared is greater post-test than pre-test. Goes from 0 to 16 / 22 in S / N groups.
S: GHG Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
N: GHG Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
S: Light Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
N: Light Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
S: Energy Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
N: Energy Objecive knowledge scores improve after the blurb
Differences in GW attitudes are significant
S pre- to post-test: Increase in self rated knowledge is highly significant (actually in hypotheses.pdf currently)
N post-test (compared to S pre-): Increase in self rated knowledge  is highly significant (actually in hypotheses.pdf currently)
